description: Amazing app to play games w/ frens and strangers if you don't mind the fact that you cannot host anything for anyone.
summary: Nice app, but cannot stream from Linux

description:
I'm using Zorin OS on my notebook - of course some games are working native by Steam, but not everything.
Fortunately I have a Windows gaming machine at home and after a short setup (installing and creating an account), I'm able to play all my games by streaming from my home PC.
It is far more powerful than TeamViewer, AnyDesk or any other remote tool, but working quite similar.
Actually I'm playing with my girlfriend Ghost Recon Wildlands at her place together just by streaming the game from a distance over 250 km.
The stream works smoothly and the quality on a 14" display is not that bad.
I have only noticed a minimal input lag, but I can handle that - the reason should be the internet connection:
My connection is around 250.000 and the one of my girlfriend is around 16.000.

It feels like that I'm using my own Google Stadia, GeForce Now or Shadow service - but for free and it's my personalised system.
Worked for a couple of days and then randomly started to throw Window initialization errors.
